channel.title: zHyperion
channel.description:
[url=https://github.com/ThomasPapp/zHyperion]zHyperion Git[/url]
[b]Introduction[/b]
Although I'm kinda done doing RSPS's, I still like to play/develop them in the little free-time that I have.
zHyperion will be an open-source project; meaning you may download the source at anytime (once I've got it uploaded to git [may take sometime since my internet is crap]). For this project I'm using the original Hyperion downloaded from [url=http://www.rune-server.org/runescape-development/google/projects/163324-hyperion.html]Graham's project thread[/url]. I plan to develop a nice clean, user-friendly Hyperion for people to use with a good amount of content. Hopefully this will get people to start using Hyperion more, seeing how there isn't much Hyperion projects anymore. I will continue to develop this until I get bored with it, or just don't have time for it.
[b]Media[/b] (View the full thread for more media)
[img]http://puu.sh/6hPQU.jpg[/img]
[img]http://puu.sh/6hQ31.jpg[/img]
[img]http://puu.sh/6iVWg.jpg[/img]
[img]http://puu.sh/6iYwz.jpg[/img]
[b]Development[/b]
[size=8pt][b][i]Development Log:[/i][/b][/size] [code] - Downloaded Hyperion - Added an object handler - Started woodcutting - Finished woodcutting - Finished mining - Completely re-wrote the NPC class - Added full NPC defs (credits to 2006Scape) - Added random NPC walking - Added NPC facing - Added an NPC auto-spawn which is loaded through XML - Added an XStream manager [/code]
Don't suspect any updates for a few days, a family member is in the hospital doing really bad so I don't have much time to-do anything as I have a bunch of family over at my house. :(

item.title: zHyperion
item.dc:creator: @south-park south-park
item.description:
@south-park wrote:

tyb97:

So far all I’ve seen you’ve done is rewrite the two skills that Graham included (which a side of me thinks you just added some rocks and trees to enumeration), and found every tutorial for it and added it. However, I am ‘almost’ certain I will see some impressive work soon, can’t wait for it.

Yes, I re-wrote the two skills that Graham included in Hyperion, however it’s all my code (except for the axe enum [I cba to make my own]); no tuts/snippets have/will ever be used.

Sorry for not doing any updates, I’ve been busy IRL and totally forgot about this project. Lol. I’ll see if I can get some updates in today.

Read full topic

item.title: zHyperion
item.dc:creator: @Kodiak Kodiak
item.description:
@Kodiak wrote:

[quote=“Docent, post:30, topic:538450”][quote author=Kodiak link=topic=657275.msg4399540#msg4399540 date=1390242047]

I thought Hyperion would’ve died by now

Why?

To be honest, I thought 317 would’ve been dead by now, considering how old it already is… But I misjudged it, quite some people still using it.

317 would be dead if other revisions had has much documentation. People don’t change revisions because then they would have to work harder to get a working server, although lately we have gained some new protocols, but for the time being 317 will most likely stay as the most used protocol.

the old graphics feel is one of the most favorited eras, 317-498ish will forever be #1 imo
[/quote]

I liked the graphics between 508-530[/quote]

if im not mistaken, thats when i REALLY got into rs, and thats the era of g.e correct? i know i joined the week of g.e, and idk i think thats it lol. but yeah those were the next best, werent too (how they are now pretty much) yet had nice updates. i sound stupid atm but you get what i mean

Read full topic
